Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T04:43:12.007Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/basic-programming/reading-stacktraces.html\"\u003elinked document\u003c/a\u003e in the error message has a lot of information on how to read the stack trace.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIn your case, it sets that driveEncoder is null on line 260 of SwerveModule.java. It says that is called from SwerveModule.java line 96. If you look around line 96, you’ll noticed that driveEncoder isn’t initialized until line 105, so driveEncoder really is null at line 96. You’ll need to reorder things so that you get the state after all your motors and encoders are intialized and configured.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T04:43:12.007Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":16,"readers_count":15,"score":3.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494106,"topic_slug":"java-rev-robotics-relative-encoder-issues","display_username":"Joe
